newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures rise on bullish soybean demand.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures rise on bullish soybean demand.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures closed higher on Monday, as bullish sentiment in the soybean markets stimulated buying in corn, traders said.
The newly listed benchmark March contract ended at 16,260 yen after opening at 15,890 yen. Other months ranged from 290 yen to 410 yen per tonne higher.
Activity was buoyant with estimated daily volume at 106,101 lots.
"Bullish sentiment toward the Chicago and domestic soybean markets, reflecting lower inventories in the U.S., helped market sentiment here," one trader said.
Traders said some private investors rolled over their positions from nearby contracts to distant months after the benchmark March contract was newly listed on Monday.
Trading on the CBOT Project A overnight trading system was closed for a U.S. holiday.
